TITLE: Biden: North America should be ‘clean energy powerhouse of the world’
New study raises the heat on Exxon's secret climate research
SUMMARY: "ExxonMobil didn’t just know ‘something’ about global warming decades ago — they knew as much as academic and government scientists knew," researchers write in the journal Science. Still, the company "worked to deny it."

TITLE: 4 things to know about the gas stove frenzy
SUMMARY: The media storm surrounding gas stoves has shined a light on the environmental effects of the appliances and existing policies governing them. Here's what to know.

TITLE: What the right’s gas stove freakout was really about
SUMMARY: The Biden administration isn't proposing to outlaw the fossil-fuel-powered appliances. But they're at the center of a growing nationwide debate about city and state gas bans — and the latest Washington culture war.

TITLE: Big winners from Biden's climate law: Republicans who voted against it
SUMMARY: GOP lawmakers voted en masse against Biden’s signature bill. But roughly two-thirds of green-energy projects announced since it became law are going to Republican-held congressional districts, a POLITICO analysis found.

TITLE: Republicans launch newest fight against Biden's oil drawdowns
SUMMARY: A bill to limit releases from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve seeks to blunt the political gains that Democrats have gained from lower gasoline prices.

TITLE: House GOP passes bill to curb Biden's use of oil reserve
SUMMARY: The bill is largely a messaging effort by Republicans.

TITLE: China’s Mideast buildup stirs security worries for U.S.
SUMMARY: Chinese state-owned companies are making billions of dollars in investments near the Strait of Hormuz, one of the world's prime conduits for oil shipments — a move that could lay the groundwork for a future military presence.

TITLE: Shrinking Colorado River hands Biden his first climate brawl
SUMMARY: California, Arizona and Nevada are among the states at odds over how to divide the river's water — a fight among powerful political and economic interests with dire consequences.

TITLE: Europe moves from anger toward acceptance of U.S. climate law
SUMMARY: After meeting with U.S. officials, ministers from France and Germany said the need for Europe to respond with its own subsidy package is clearer than ever.

TITLE: EPA's refinery exemptions denial not subject to Congressional Review Act, GAO says
SUMMARY: The determination closes the door on potential efforts by lawmakers to use the law to undo the agency's action.

TITLE: How Biden's climate spending could transform Nevada
SUMMARY: Nevada is receiving billions of dollars in support from the Biden administration to boost electric vehicles and batteries, a development that is set to upend the state's economy and influence the nation's clean energy targets.

TITLE: Nevada Gov. Lombardo's awkward moment with Energy Secretary Granholm
What climate law? Voters clueless about Biden's top achievement
SUMMARY: The president is hitting the road to get the message out on the Inflation Reduction Act, an effort that may be crucial to his hopes for 2024.

TITLE: Watch: Ohio train derailment leads to massive flames, toxic fumes
